bibl.title: The Medical and Surgical History of the War of the Rebellion. (1861-65.)

taxonomy.bibl: Medical and Surgical History of the War of the Rebellion

keywords.term: wounds and injuries of the lower extremities
wounds and injuries of the knee joint
punctured and incised wounds of the knee joint
incised wounds of the knee joint
incised wounds of the knee joint treated without operative interference
incised wound of knee accidentally inflicted with axe

revisionDesc.change: additional proofing of transcription and encoding, identified keyword terms
case text extracted and transformed from larger file
initial checking of OCR text; encoded P5 Encoding

body.p: CASE 523.—Private A. G. Hill, Co. G, 43d New York, aged 25 years, was admitted into Finley Hospital, Washington, March 25, 1864, with an incised wound of the right knee, inflicted with an axe, accidentally, at Brandy Station, Virginia, February 19, 1864. Surgeon G. L. Pancoast, U. S. V., reports that he died May 21, 1864, from the effects of the wound.
